events.title: Venezuela attack: what we know so far as Trump claims Maduro captured
events.description: US president confirms attack on Venezuela and says Nicolás Maduro and wife Cilia Flores have been flown out of country •​ US strikes on Venezuela – live updates The US president, Donald Trump, has said Venezuela’s dictator, Nicolás Maduro, and his wife, Cilia Flores, have been captured and flown out of the country after a “large scale” pre-dawn assault on Caracas and the surrounding region. Here is what we know so far: US attorney general Pam Bondi says deposed Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores , will face criminal charges after an indictment in New York. Bondi vowed in a social media post that the couple will “soon face the full wrath of American justice on American soil in American courts”. In a statement on X, US secretary of state Marco Rubio said Maduro is “under indictment for pushing drugs in the United States”. Republican US Senator Mike Lee said on Saturday that Rubio had told him that he “anticipates no further action in Venezuela now that Maduro is in US custody”. Earlier, Donald Trump posted on his Truth Social platform that the US had “captured” Venezuela’s dictator, Maduro, and his wife, and flown them out of the South American country after a pre-dawn assault on Caracas and the surrounding region. Venezuela’s government accused the US of launching a series of attacks against civilian and military targets in the South American country, after explosions rocked its capital, Caracas, before dawn on Saturday. In a statement, Venezuela’s government urged citizens to rise up against the assault and said Washington risked plunging Latin America into chaos with “an extremely serious” act of “military aggression”. It added: “The entire country must mobilise to defeat this imperialist aggression.” Explosions and low-flying aircraft were heard in Caracas in the early hours of Saturday. In its statement, Venezuela’s government confirmed that the city had come under attack, as well as three other states: Miranda , La Guaira and Aragua . Venezuela has accused the US of trying to “seize control” of country’s resources, in particular its oil and minerals. Th country has called on the international community to denounce what it called a flagrant violation of international law that put millions of lives at risk. In the early hours of Saturday the president of neighbouring Colombia, Gustavo Petro , called for an immediate emergency session of the UN security council , saying on social media that Venezuela had come under attack. UK prime minister Keir Starmer has reacted to Donald Trump’s military action in Venezuela saying: “The UK was not involved in any way in this operation.” He added that “we should all uphold international law”. Russia has demanded “immediate” clarification about the circumstances of the capture of Maduro during an attack ordered by Trump. Earlier, Venezuela’s vice-president, Delcy Rodríguez, said the US needed to provide “proof of life” for Maduro. Brazil’s president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva , said the US bombardment of Venezuelan territory and the capture of Maduro “cross an unacceptable line”, amounting to a “grave affront to Venezuela’s sovereignty and yet another extremely dangerous precedent” for the international community. Continue reading...

events.title: Why has US attacked Caracas and captured Venezuela’s president?
events.description: Trump’s unprecedented capture of Nicolás Maduro follows months of military campaign and years of strained relationship • US attacks Venezuela – live updates Overnight on Friday, the US carried out airstrikes across Venezuela, with explosions rocking the capital, Caracas, before dawn. Shortly afterwards, Donald Trump announced that US forces had captured the Venezuelan president, Nicolás Maduro, and his wife, Cilia Flores, and flown them out of the country. The stunning attack and unprecedented capture of a sitting president follow months of an intense US pressure campaign against Venezuela. Since September, the US navy has amassed a huge fleet off the Venezuelan coast and carried out airstrikes against alleged drug-trafficking boats in the Caribbean and the Pacific and seized Venezuelan oil tankers. At least 110 people have been killed in the strikes on boats, which human rights groups say could amount to war crimes. Venezuelan officials have accused the US of trying to gain access to the country’s oil reserves, the largest in the world. The bombardment of Venezuela and the capture of Maduro is a serious and dramatic escalation of the US campaign. The future of Venezuela’s ruling regime remains uncertain. Continue reading...

events.title: US launches military strikes on Venezuela after Trump's threats against Maduro
events.description: Venezuela has accused the United States of launching attacks after a series of explosions struck Caracas and other regions, prompting President Nicolás Maduro to say his government had repelled what he called U.S. military aggression and to declare a state of emergency. The blasts were reported around 2 a.m. local time, accompanied by the sound of aircraft overhead, with smoke seen rising from a military base hangar and power outages affecting parts of the capital. U.S. officials told Reuters that American forces were conducting strikes inside Venezuela, amid an expanded U.S. military presence in the region aimed at intercepting alleged drug trafficking vessels linked to the country. Washington Bureau Chief at The Guardian, David Smith, tells us more.

events.title: US State Dept. says Venezuelan President Maduro will 'face justice'
events.description: President Donald Trump claimed on social media that the U.S. had successfully conducted large-scale strikes in Venezuela, capturing President Nicolás Maduro and his wife, who were reportedly flown out of the country. Earlier, Maduro accused the U.S. of causing a series of explosions in Caracas and other areas and declared a state of emergency. Around 2 a.m. local time, explosions and the sound of aircraft were reported over the capital, with smoke rising from a military base hangar and parts of the city losing power. The developments come amid an increased U.S. military presence in the region, reportedly targeting suspected drug-trafficking vessels linked to Venezuela. Peter O'Brien has the latest.

events.title: Coast Guard searches for survivors after US strikes suspected narco-terrorist vessels in Eastern Pacific
events.description: The U.S. Coast Guard is searching for survivors after strikes on suspected drug vessels in the Eastern Pacific. Three alleged narco-terrorists were killed, and others are missing.

events.title: Young man killed in apparent targeted drive-by shooting near police station in Melbourne’s inner north
events.description: Police investigation continues after fatal shooting in Fitzroy in early hours of Saturday morning Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A young man has been killed in what police believe was a targeted drive-by shooting outside a police station in Melbourne’s inner north in the early hours of Saturday morning. The attack took place just after midnight when a passing car opened fire on two young men walking across the road from a police station in Fitzroy. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela seeks UN Security Council meeting on US bombings, foreign ministry says
events.description: The Venezuelan government on Saturday demanded "immediate proof of life" of President Nicolas Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores after the US announced he had been captured and taken out of the country. Maduro's whereabouts remain unknown after the US conducted a "large-scale strike" earlier in the day with multiple explosions and aircraft-like sounds reported across the capital Caracas. France24 journalist Shirli Sitbon together with journalist Noris Argotte Soto explain.

events.title: Trump says Maduro 'captured and flown out' of Venezuela
events.description: US President Donald Trump announced on Saturday that Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has been captured after the US conducted a "large-scale strike" on the country. Maduro had declared a state of emergency earlier in the day, accusing the United States of a “very serious military aggression” after multiple explosions and aircraft-like sounds were reported across the capital Caracas. France24 journalist Shirli Sitbon explains further.

events.title: Venezuela: At least 7 explosions and low-flying aircraft heard in Caracas
events.description: US President Donald Trump announced on Saturday that Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has been captured after the US conducted a "large-scale strike" on the country. Maduro had declared a state of emergency earlier in the day, accusing the United States of a “very serious military aggression” after multiple explosions and aircraft-like sounds were reported across the capital Caracas. Noris Argotte Soto reports from Caracas.

events.title: Cuba denounces ‘state terrorism’ as Venezuela’s ‘zone of peace’ is brutally assaulted
events.description: Cuba ‍has ​denounced what ⁠it described as a "criminal" US attack on ​Venezuela ‍and is ​urgently calling for a ​reaction from the international community, the Cuban presidency said. The ‍presidency accused ​the United States of "state terrorism" against the ‌Venezuelan people and said ‍what it described as a "zone of peace" was being "brutally ‍assaulted." France24 correspondent Ed Augustin reports the latest from Cuba.

events.title: UN, US sign $2 billion humanitarian funding agreement for 17 crisis-hit countries
events.description: The United Nations and the United States on Monday formalized an agreement under which the US committed $2 billion in humanitarian assistance for global relief programmes, a move the UN’s top relief official hailed as a landmark commitment to saving lives amid escalating humanitarian needs worldwide.

events.title: Iran threatens Trump after 'locked and loaded' warning
events.description: Donald Trump has been threatened with a "swift, decisive and comprehensive" response by Iran if the US intervenes following growing unrest in the country, with at least 10 people killed and dozens of arrests, according to reports.

events.title: Anthony Joshua’s driver charged with dangerous driving after fatal crash in Nigeria
events.description: British boxer was injured in collision that killed his personal trainer Latif Ayodele and strength coach Sina Ghami Nigerian police have charged Anthony Joshua’s driver with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal crash that killed two people. Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, 46, was also charged with driving without a valid driving licence and “driving without due care and attention, causing bodily harm and damage to property”. He is due to appear in court on 20 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuelan leader Maduro and wife indicted in New York on drug, terrorism charges
events.description: The United States on Saturday announced terrorism and drugs charges against Venezulean President Nicolas Maduro, just hours after saying he had been captured and flown out of the country. The Venezuelan government demanded "immediate proof of life" of Maduro and his wife after a US "large-scale strike" rocked Caracas with explosions and aircraft-like sounds. Washington Bureau Chief at The Guardian, David Smith, together with France24 journalist Shirli Sitbon, share their insights.

events.title: Drop draft proposals on death penalty for Palestinians, UN rights chief urges Israel
events.description: The UN’s top human rights official on Friday called on Israeli authorities to abandon plans for new legislation that would impose mandatory death sentences exclusively on Palestinians, warning the proposals violate international law and fundamental human rights standards.

events.title: FBI disrupts alleged ISIS-inspired New Year’s Eve attack plot targeting NC grocery store, fast food restaurant
events.description: Prosecutors say Christian Sturdivant, 18, of Mint Hill, N.C., allegedly plotted an attack on New Year's Eve in support of the Islamic State terrorist group.

events.title: Trump warning over Iran protests 'reckless' says foreign minister
events.description: The US president earlier said if peaceful protesters are killed, Washington "will come to their rescue".

events.title: Aboriginal woman’s death in custody in NT prompts calls for independent investigation
events.description: Police say woman’s death in Tennant Creek appeared to be the result of a medical episode, but Aboriginal legal service says internal investigation is ‘not sufficient’ Warning: This article contains references to Indigenous Australians who have died Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Northern Territory’s peak Aboriginal legal service has called for an independent investigation after a 44-year-old Aboriginal mother of five died at the Tennant Creek watch house last Saturday. NT police said her death appeared to be the result of a medical episode inside her cell on 27 December, after she was arrested on Christmas Day for an alleged aggravated assault. Indigenous Australians can call 13YARN on 13 92 76 for information and crisis support; or call Lifeline on 13 11 14, Mensline on 1300 789 978 or Beyond Blue on 1300 22 4636 Continue reading...

events.title: Mexico: Powerful earthquake kills at least 2 people
events.description: The magnitude 6.5 earthquake shook the center and south of the country, which is one of the most seismically active in the world. The capital Mexico City and tourist hotspot Acapulco were affected.

events.title: Ukrainians remember broken 1994 security promises as it negotiates with Russia
events.description: Ukrainians recall their country giving up nuclear weapons in 1994 in exchange for international security promises that weren't kept. They don't want a repeat in their current negotiations with Russia.

events.title: Woman suspected to have been killed in Colorado's first fatal mountain lion attack in over two decades
events.description: A woman's death on a trail is being investigated as a suspected deadly mountain lion attack, according to Colorado Parks and Wildlife.

events.title: 'Rioters must be put in their place,' says Iran’s Khamenei as death toll reaches at least 10
events.description: Iran’s supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei addressed the country’s protests on Saturday, insisting that “rioters must be put in their place". At least 10 people have been killed in the protests so far, including members of the security services, according to official figures.

events.title: US captures Venezuelan leader Maduro in ‘large scale’ strike on country, Trump announces
events.description: The Venezuelan government on Saturday demanded "immediate proof of life" of President Nicolas Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores after the US announced he had been captured and taken out of the country. Maduro's whereabouts remain unknown after the US conducted a "large-scale strike" earlier in the day with multiple explosions and aircraft-like sounds reported across the capital Caracas. Chatham House Senior Research Fellow for Latin America, Christopher Sabatini, shares his insights.

events.title: Venezuela: Trump says "Maduro has been captured and flown out" of the country
events.description: The Venezuelan government on Saturday demanded "immediate proof of life" of President Nicolas Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores after the US announced he had been captured and taken out of the country. Maduro's whereabouts remain unknown after the US conducted a "large-scale strike" earlier in the day with multiple explosions and aircraft-like sounds reported across the capital Caracas. Member of the Sciences Po's Political Observatory of Latin America, Eduardo Rios, and journalist Noris Argotte Sodo, explain further.

events.title: Saudi airstrikes kill seven as rift with UAE-backed separatists deepens in Yemen
events.description: Separatist forces in Yemen say at least seven people were killed in Saudi airstrikes on Friday, as tensions deepen between regional allies. The strikes come while the Saudi-backed governor of Hadramout province says “peaceful” efforts are underway to retake military bases abandoned by Emirati-backed separatists, highlighting the latest escalation in the rift between Riyadh and Abu Dhabi. Once united in their campaign against Houthi rebels, the two Gulf powers are now backing rival factions in Yemen’s ongoing conflict. Carys Garland reports the latest.

events.title: WHO research shows COVID vaccines still crucial in preventing severe illness
events.description: Up-to-date vaccination remains the most effective way to prevent severe COVID-19 illness, new research from the World Health Organization (WHO) shows, even as the pandemic has officially ended.

events.title: US has captured Venezuela’s President Maduro and wife, says Trump
events.description: US president lauds ‘brilliant operation’ on social media as attorney general says couple will face criminal charges US attacks Venezuela – live updates What we know so far about the attack Watch: Aircraft fly low over Caracas as explosions hit city Donald Trump has said the US “captured” Venezuela’s president, Nicolás Maduro, and his wife, Cilia Flores, and flew them out of the South American country during a pre-dawn assault on Caracas and the surrounding region. “It was a brilliant operation, actually,” the US president told the New York Times after witnesses in Venezuela reported a series of explosions. “A lot of good planning and [a] lot of great, great troops and great people.” Continue reading...

events.title: Police to carry long-arm rifles at final Ashes Test in Sydney amid heightened security after Bondi attack
events.description: Decision to carry the weapons at SCG not due to active or imminent threat but ‘to help the public feel safe’, NSW police chief says Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Police will carry long-arm rifles at the final Ashes Test in Sydney as police presence continues to be heightened after the Bondi terror attack. New South Wales police said public order and riot squad officers would carry the weapons at the fifth and final Ashes Test, which starts on Sunday at the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG), after similar measures were implemented at the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne and New Year’s Eve events in Sydney. Continue reading...

events.title: Six people injured in the fatal fire at a Swiss bar remain unidentified. It's an unbearable wait
events.description: A fire at a bar in Crans-Montana, Switzerland, has left families desperate for news about missing loved ones

events.title: UN chief urges world leaders to ‘get priorities straight’ as New Year message calls for peace over war
events.description: As the world enters 2026 amid mounting crises, the UN Secretary-General António Guterres has issued a stark but hopeful New Year appeal, urging global leaders to shift resources away from destruction and towards development, peace and people.

events.title: Iran in shutdown as protesters storm governor's office, crowds chant 'Death to Khamenei'
events.description: Iran security forces clashed with protesters in Tehran, Shiraz and Kermanshah as opposition groups report gunfire and demonstrators chant "Death to Khamenei" during unrest.

events.title: Two people killed in magnitude 6.5 earthquake in Mexico
events.description: The powerful earthquake shook southern and central Mexico on Friday, also leaving several people injured.

events.title: Trump says US will be ‘strongly involved’ in Venezuela oil industry after Caracas attacked and Maduro captured – live
events.description: Donald Trump says Nicolás Maduro and wife captured by US during ‘large scale strike against Venezuela’ Full report: US captures Maduro during ‘large scale’ attack Why has US attacked Caracas and captured Venezuela’s president? What we know so far about the attack Watch: Aircraft fly low over Caracas as explosions hit city The Reuters news agency says it has been told by a US official, speaking on the condition of anonymity, that the US carried out strikes inside Venezuela on Saturday . The unnamed official did not provide details. As mentioned earlier, the White House and Pentagon did not immediately respond to request for comment on Saturday morning. Continue reading...

events.title: NSW Labor accused of rushing inquiry into banning phrases such as ‘globalise the intifada’ over the holidays
events.description: State opposition leader says inquiry established ‘with no notice, no public hearings and an impossibly short deadline’ Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A New South Wales parliamentary inquiry into banning phrases including “globalise the intifada” will not hold any public hearings and has a matter of days to receive submissions before it produces its final report. The NSW opposition has expressed concern that the Labor-controlled inquiry, established to investigate the banning of “hateful statements” after the deadly Bondi attack, was being rushed through, limiting the ability of communities to consult on legislative changes. Continue reading...

events.title: Missile attack on Kharkiv kills two including child, authorities say
events.description: Russian officials say reports of the missile strike are untrue, suggesting the explosion was caused by Ukrainian ammunition.

events.title: Ukraine hosts security talks in Kyiv after strike hit Kharkiv on Friday
events.description: As the war in Ukraine enters the new year, Russian bombardments continue to hit Ukrainian cities, with authorities reporting on Friday that residential areas in Kharkiv were targeted. Amid Russia’s largest battlefield gains since 2022, Ukraine has ordered the evacuation of 3,000 children from the Dnipro and Zaporizhia regions. Caroline Baum reports.

events.title: Crans-Montana: About 40 killed, 119 injured in fire
events.description: As Switzerland mourns, authorities are continuing to investigate the cause of the deadly fire and now believe it was triggered by sparklers placed on champagne bottles that came too close to the bar’s ceiling. Investigators are also examining whether the venue’s materials met fire safety regulations. Meanwhile, families anxiously await news of their loved ones, as some victims have been transferred to specialized burn units in hospitals in France and Italy, while six people remain unidentified. Simon Mortiz and Valériane Gauthier have more.

events.title: Health advances marked 2025 as wars and funding cuts strained systems
events.description: From eliminating deadly infections to expanding access to lifesaving vaccines, 2025 delivered meaningful progress for global health, according to the UN World Health Organization (WHO), offering cautious optimism at the close of a year marked by both breakthroughs and strain.

events.title: World reacts to US bombing of Venezuela, ‘capture’ of Maduro
events.description: Donald Trump says the US has carried out a 'large scale strike' against Venezuela and captured its president.

events.title: Afghanistan to remain major crisis in 2026, UN, partners warn
events.description: Afghanistan is expected to remain one of the world’s largest humanitarian crises in 2026, UN agencies and humanitarian partners warned on Tuesday, launching a $1.7 billion appeal to assist nearly 18 million people in urgent need.

events.title: Iran protests turn deadly as anti-regime demonstrations enter fifth day
events.description: Anti-regime protests entered a fifth day as demonstrations spread across Tehran and other cities, with reports of deaths emerging amid escalating nationwide unrest.

events.title: Britain not involved in US Venezuela attack, says Keir Starmer
events.description: UK prime minister describes situation as fast-moving and is waiting for more details to emerge • US strikes on Venezuela – live updates Sir Keir Starmer has said the UK was not involved in the US operation in Venezuela, in which the country’s president, Nicolás Maduro, and his wife were “captured” by special forces and the capital, Caracas, hit with airstrikes. Speaking for the first time since Donald Trump launched his extraordinary attack, the prime minister said he had not spoken to the US president, and that the UK was keen to establish “the facts” of what had happened. Continue reading...

events.title: Saudi-backed forces advance in Yemen’s Hadramawt, military says
events.description: Yemen's Saudi-backed, internationally recognised government, said on Saturday it ⁠had retaken control of Mukalla, the key eastern port and capital of Hadramout province, from UAE-backed southern separatists who seized it last month.

events.title: Political violence has 'just started,’ former FBI agent warns in 2026 outlook
events.description: Former FBI agent warns political violence has "just started" as 2026 begins, citing Charlie Kirk's alleged assassination and ICE attacks.

events.title: US: FBI arrests man over alleged NYE attack plot
events.description: The man had pledged loyalty to the Islamic State group and was allegedly planning a knife-and-hammer attack in North Carolina. Undercover agents foiled the terror plot, the FBI said.

events.title: Iran blasts Trump's intervention threat
events.description: Iran’s UN ambassador, Amir Saeed Iravani, has urged the UN secretary-general and the president of the Security Council to condemn what he calls “unlawful threats” from U.S. President Donald Trump, following his statement that the U.S. was “locked and loaded and ready to go” if more protesters were killed amid ongoing demonstrations in Iran over the rising cost of living. Assistant Professor of Middle East Politics in Washington DC, Sina Azodi, explains further.

events.title: Transport Canada warns Air India on drinking rules after pilot's Vancouver arrest
events.description: An Air India pilot was arrested at Vancouver International Airport last week while preparing for a flight

events.title: SECURITY COUNCIL LIVE: Briefing on threats to international peace and security
events.description: The UN Security Council meets today to hear a briefing on threats to international peace and security following Israel’s recent recognition of the northern region of Somalia as an independent and sovereign state. Follow live below and UN News app users can click here and go here for all our in-depth meeting coverage.

events.title: Dozens missing after boat carrying 200 migrants sinks off Gambia
events.description: It is the latest accident on one of the world’s most dangerous routes used by West Africans trying to reach Spain.

events.title: Protests spread across Iran as regime threatens US forces as 'legitimate targets' after Trump warning
events.description: Iran's parliament speaker threatens U.S. military bases as 'legitimate targets' after Trump vows action over protest crackdowns. Tensions escalate.

events.title: Trump vows to 'rescue' Iran's protesters. Iran warns the U.S. to stay out of it
events.description: President Trump warned Iran not to kill protesters. Iranian officials alleged the U.S. and Israel were stoking the sweeping protests, and said U.S. military bases in the region are legitimate targets.

events.title: Explosions heard in Venezuelan capital of Caracas
events.description: Explosions reported in Venezuelan capital city amid tensions with the US.

events.title: Crans-Montana fire: 16 French nationals injured, nine unaccounted for
events.description: Sixteen French nationals were injured in a fire in a bar on New Year’s Eve in Crans-Montana, Switzerland, and nine remain unaccounted for, according to an updated report released Saturday by the French Foreign Ministry.

events.title: In their words: Survivors and others talk about fatal Swiss Alpine bar fire
events.description: In the aftermath of a fire inside a Swiss Alpine bar that killed 40 people celebrating the new year, survivors, friends and family members, the region’s top authorities and even Pope Leo have spoken to the public in remarks in French, Italian, German a...

events.title: Woman killed in suspected mountain lion attack in US
events.description: Colorado officials said that it would be the first time in more than 25 years that a mountain lion killed a person in the state, if confirmed.

events.title: US says it has captured Venezuelan President Maduro
events.description: Trump says the US carried out strikes on Venezuela and captured its leader, in a breach of international law.

events.title: How the region is reacting to U.S. strikes on Venezuela
events.description: NPR international correspondent Eyder Peralta joins NPR's Daniel Estrin to discuss reaction from Venezuela and other countries in the region.

events.title: Trump says U.S. carried out 'large-scale strike' against Venezuela
events.description: NPR's Daniel Estrin discusses the latest with NPR international correspondent Carrie Kahn.

events.title: What we know about the alleged ISIS-inspired New Year’s Eve terror suspect
events.description: Details are emerging Friday about Christian Sturdivant, the 18-year-old who allegedly plotted an ISIS-inspired New Year's Eve attack in North Carolina.

events.title: How K-beauty went from a viral trend to an economic powerhouse
events.description: Inside the K-beauty industry that has made South Korea a major player in worldwide beauty market.

events.title: Russia says 27 dead in Ukrainian strike; Zelenskyy names intell chief to new role
events.description: Russian authorities say a Ukrainian drone strike on a café in the Kherson region has killed 27 people

events.title: Revelers at Swiss Alpine bar describe horror and panic when a fire broke out, leaving about 40 dead
events.description: A New Year’s party at a Swiss Alpine bar turned into a tragedy after about 40 people died in a fire and another roughly 115 were injured, many in their teens to mid-20s

events.title: Ukraine: Attacks disrupt heating as temperatures plunge
events.description: Recent attacks across Ukraine have killed civilians, damaged critical infrastructure and cut heating and power supplies for millions, UN humanitarians report, as temperatures drop below freezing.

events.title: What we know about Maduro's capture
events.description: Explosions were seen in capital Caracas as President Nicolas Maduro was detained by the US.

events.title: Iran protests: Trump and Tehran officials exchange threats
events.description: President Donald Trump said the US is "locked and loaded," but analysts told DW that more violence wouldn't help protesters.

events.title: Security Council: New faces, old tensions as five nations take their seats
events.description: From deploying peacekeepers to conducting quiet – but at times heated – diplomacy, the UN Security Council sits at the heart of global decision-making on war and peace. As of January, five new countries will have a seat around the iconic horseshoe table.

events.title: Pope Leo XIV opens 2026 urging world to reject violence in powerful New Year's Day message
events.description: Pope Leo XIV delivered a message of peace to 40,000 gathered in St. Peter's Square on New Year's Day, calling for disarmed hearts and an end to all forms of violence in 2026.

events.title: Severe weather in Gaza hits vulnerable and wounded most in Israel’s war
events.description: As harsh weather conditions hit the Strip once again, people wounded in the war suffer the most.

events.title: Venezuelan journalist describes moment of ‘targeted airstrikes’
events.description: A journalist in Venezuela described explosions during what she says were ‘targeted airstrikes’ on Caracas.

events.title: Tensions between Saudis and Emiratis over future of Yemen reach boiling point
events.description: Dispute has potential to create civil war in south of Yemen and spill over into neighbouring countries Tensions between the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia over the future of Yemen and the imminent possibility of the declaration of an independent southern state have reached boiling point with Saudi Arabia in effect accusing the UAE of threatening its future security. The dispute has the potential to create a civil war within the south of Yemen and also spill over into other disputes including in Sudan and the Horn of Africa where the two countries often find themselves backing opposite sides. Yemen could yet become only one theatre in which the two vastly wealthy Gulf states vie for political influence, control of shipping lanes and commercial access. Continue reading...

events.title: Missing worker could be trapped 1km underground after Queensland mine collapses
events.description: Two workers have been recovered safely from Curragh coalmine as search continues for missing man Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A worker is missing and another is recovering in hospital after a roof collapse at a coalmine. Police were called to Curragh coalmine, in central Queensland, about 3pm on Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: Sexual violence against children ‘entrenched, systemic and widespread’ across DR Congo, UNICEF warns
events.description: Sexual violence against children has become entrenched, systemic and increasingly widespread across the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), with new data showing a sharp rise in cases since 2022, according to the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF).

events.title: Runner fought off mountain lion with stick just weeks before fatal attack on same Colorado trail
events.description: A Colorado hiker fought off a mountain lion with a stick after being rushed on a trail where a woman was found dead weeks later in a suspected wildlife attack.

events.title: Off-duty ICE agent takes down armed man firing rifle at LA apartment complex
events.description: Off-duty ICE agent confronted armed neighbor firing rifle shots into the air at Los Angeles apartment complex on New Year's Eve, fatally shooting the gunman.

events.title: US capture of Maduro championed, condemned across world stage after surgical Venezuela strikes
events.description: World leaders react with condemnation, concern and praise after President Donald Trump announces strikes on Venezuela and capture of Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Putin residence attack video slammed; US officials say Ukraine did not target leader
events.description: Defense experts questioned Russia's drone attack claims against President Vladimir Putin's residence after Moscow provides conflicting accounts of intercepted Ukrainian drones.

events.title: Maduro capture is raising the bar “against international norms”
events.description: “[Trump] has framed Maduro as the evil in this scenario and is going to go for him.”

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: George Clooney gets French citizenship — and another dust-up with Trump
events.description: The French government says it granted George and Amal Clooney citizenship because of their contributions to its international influence. Their family has primarily lived in France since 2021.

events.title: What images and videos tell us about why Swiss bar fire spread so quickly
events.description: How the blaze took hold with such ferocity, killing at least 40 people and leaving many more critically injured, is now a key focus for officials.

events.title: Trump statement on ‘Maduro capture’ during US attack on Venezuela
events.description: US President Donald Trump says that Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has been captured.

events.title: Pakistan sentences journalists, YouTubers and ex-military officers to life over inciting violence
events.description: A court in Pakistan’s capital has sentenced seven people to life imprisonment after convicting them of inciting violence

events.title: European security advisors discuss peace proposals in Kyiv ahead of leaders' summit
events.description: European national security advisors have arrived in Kyiv to discuss peace proposals as a U.S.-led diplomatic push to end the war in Ukraine intensifies

events.title: Trump confirms US strike in Venezuela, says President Nicolas Maduro has been 'captured'
events.description: The U.S. military carried out air strikes in various areas of Venezuela, including the capital of Caracas, early Saturday morning, officials confirmed to Fox News.

events.title: Anthony Joshua's driver charged over Nigeria crash that killed two
events.description: The former heavyweight champion was a passenger in the crash, which killed two of his team members on Monday.

events.title: Footage shows Saudi-backed forces advancing in southern Yemen
events.description: Video shows Saudi-backed forces advancing towards the Yemeni city of Mukalla, seizing new areas in Hadramout.

events.title: Video shows aftermath of explosions in Venezuela
events.description: Video from the port city of La Guaira shows the aftermath of explosions that took place across Venezuela.

events.title: Fire at Swiss resort bar kills 40 people, injures over 100
events.description: About 40 people are dead and more than 100 are injured after a fire ripped through a New Year's Eve party at a Swiss ski resort bar. Authorities are still investigating what caused the blaze.

events.title: The US has followed through on its Venezuela threats - how did we get here?
events.description: After months of rising tensions, a build-up of US warships in the Caribbean and escalating threats of military action, America has struck Venezuela.

events.title: How hundreds have died in nightclub blazes caused by indoor fireworks
events.description: The death of at least 40 people in a New Year's Eve fire in a Swiss ski resort has once again highlighted the dangers of igniting indoor fireworks in bars and nightclubs.

events.title: Trump warns US will intervene if Iran starts killing protesters and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: France reportedly planning to ban children under 15 from social media starting 2026
events.description: France planning social media ban for children under 15, following Australia's lead. Macron pushes new digital restrictions amid youth violence concerns.

events.title: Deadly earthquake rattles southern and central Mexico
events.description: A 6.5-magnitude earthquake struck southern and central Mexico on Friday, killing and injuring several people.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.5 rattles southern and central Mexico
events.description: A strong earthquake rattled southern and central Mexico, interrupting President Claudia Sheinbaum’s first press briefing of the new year as seismic alarms sounded

events.title: A woman dies from cervical cancer every two minutes, UN says
events.description: A flood of questions drowned Jeanette in thought after she was diagnosed with cervical cancer. Would she be unable to conceive a child? Would she have to enter menopause at the early age of 31?

events.title: Another child dies in extreme conditions in Gaza: UNICEF
events.description: A sixth child has died in Gaza this month as the enclave’s people continue to endure dire living conditions linked to freezing rains and the Israel-Hamas war, the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF) has announced. The development comes as aid agencies urged Israeli authorities to reconsider revoking the licences of dozens of humanitarian partners that provide assistance across the devastated enclave from 1 January.

events.title: Maduro 'captured and flown out' of Venezuela, Trump says
events.description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has been captured and flown out of Venezuela to face criminal charges in the US, according to President Trump. The US conducted a 'large-scale strike" on the country. DW has more.

events.title: Ukraine: Zelenskyy names new chief of staff
events.description: Ukraine's popular military intelligence head, Kyrylo Budanov, has been appointed chief of staff. Meanwhile, Ukraine has reported two missile strikes in residential areas of Kharkiv.

events.title: Swiss fire safety under scrutiny after Crans-Montana blaze
events.description: After the deadly fire at the Constellation bar in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana, questions are growing about the country's safety regulations.

events.title: Everything we know about US strikes on Venezuela
events.description: The US has carried out a "large-scale strike" against Venezuela, and its leader, Nicolas Maduro, has been flown out of the country with his wife.

events.title: Everything we know about US strikes on Venezuela
events.description: The US has carried out a "large-scale strike" against Venezuela, and its leader, Nicolas Maduro, has been flown out of the country with his wife.

events.title: Sudan: UN warns of unprecedented child hunger in Darfur as fighting fuels refugee exodus
events.description: Sudan’s deepening war is driving unprecedented levels of hunger, child malnutrition and displacement, UN agencies report, as new data from Darfur and a renewed refugee influx into Chad underscore the rapidly deteriorating situation.

events.title: Gaza battered by heavy rains as humanitarian response continues
events.description: Severe weather conditions have led to further casualties and heightened health risks in Gaza over the past 24 hours, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) reported on Monday.

events.title: California defies deadline on immigrant trucker licenses as feds threaten funding cuts
events.description: California delays crackdown on immigrant commercial driver's licenses until March, defying federal deadline and risking $160 million in funding cuts.

events.title: Ukraine tricks Russia into paying $500K bounty for fake hit on Putin opponent: report
events.description: Ukraine faked the assassination of Russian opposition leader Denis Kapustin to trick Moscow into paying a $500,000 bounty that funded the war effort.

events.title: At least 40 dead in fire at Swiss Alps bar during New Year’s celebrations, police say
events.description: An explosive fire broke out during a New Year’s Eve celebration at a crowded bar in the Swiss Alps, killing around 40 people and injuring others, according to Swiss police.

events.title: China's BYD overtakes Tesla as world's top EV seller
events.description: It marks the first time the Chinese firm has outpaced its American rival for annual sales.

events.title: Iran’s Khamenei says rioters ‘must be put in their place’ amid protests
events.description: Supreme leader says authorities should only 'talk to protesters', not rioters, as antigovernment demonstrations grow.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world’s oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. Continue reading...

events.title: China's BYD overtakes Tesla as world's top EV seller
events.description: Elon Musk's Tesla has had a tough year and faced intensifying competition from Chinese and European rivals.

events.title: India: Contamined water blamed as diarrhoea outbreak kills 10 in Indore
events.description: At least 10 people have died and more than 250 others have been hospitalized in a diarrhoea outbreak in the central Indian city of Indore, according to local health officials, who say the illness was caused by contaminated drinking water. Residents have complained that authorities have failed to address longstanding problems with the sewage system, which they believe contributed to the outbreak. Peter O'Brien tells us more.

events.title: Why Trump's removal of Maduro is unprecedented - and what it means for the world
events.description: Donald Trump's removal of Nicolas Maduro as leader of Venezuela is completely unprecedented.

events.title: Trump, top Iranian security official exchange threats over protests now roiling Iran
events.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and a top Iranian security official have exchanged dueling threats as widening economic protests swept across parts of the Islamic Republic

events.title: Fox News ‘Antisemitism Exposed’ Newsletter: You won't believe what TikTok was selling
events.description: Fox News' "Antisemitism Exposed" newsletter brings you stories on the rising anti-Jewish prejudice across the U.S. and the world.

events.title: Officials race to identify mostly young victims of deadly Swiss Alps bar fire
events.description: Deadly New Year's Eve bar fire at Swiss ski resort kills around 40 people, mostly young victims as the investigation and identification process continues.

events.title: China’s ‘condom tax’ sparks backlash as Beijing struggles to reverse population collapse
events.description: China introduced a 13% tax on contraceptives while exempting childcare services as the global superpower battles sustained population decline and aging demographics.

events.title: Trump bombs Venezuela, US ‘captures’ Maduro: All that we know
events.description: Venezuelan vice president says Maduro's whereabouts unknown after dramatic attacks capping months of tension.

events.title: Saudi Arabia welcomes request from Yemen to help resolve southern battle
events.description: Saudi foreign ministry calls on southern factions in Yemen to participate in a forum in Riyadh amid rising casualties.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: U.S. hit Venezuela with 'large-scale strike,' captured Nicolás Maduro, Trump says
events.description: President Trump claimed overnight that the United States carried out airstrikes in Venezuela and captured President Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Israeli podcast duo use platform to reflect on the war in Gaza
events.description: A podcast by two Israelis re-examines the war in Gaza and its impact on Israeli society.

events.title: Ukraine: European advisers discuss further steps in Kyiv
events.description: European security advisers arrive in Kyiv to "work on framework agreements" as a 20-point proposal to halt the war in Ukraine struggles to make it over the finish line. US also set to join talks by video link.

events.title: What is behind Trump's ouster of Venezuela's Maduro?
events.description: The latest attacks on Caracas suggest regime change is top of the White House agenda when it comes to Venezuela. But the ultimate purpose may not be purely to restore democracy.

events.title: Yemen separatists plan transition to independence by 2028
events.description: The Southern Transitional Council said independence would be "immediate" if attacks against them continue.

events.title: Zelensky names spy boss chief to head presidential administration in big shakeup
events.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy named Ukraine's military intelligence chief Kyrylo Budanov as his top adviser on Friday and proposed a drone and digitalisation specialist as defence minister. The appointments were made as Kyiv seeks to strengthen its hand in U.S.-backed talks to end its nearly four-year-old conflict with Russia. France24 correspondent from Ukraine, Emmanuele Chaze, tells us the latest.

events.title: How sanctions are boosting Russian wine
events.description: You've probably never had a glass of Russian sparkling wine before. Perhaps you never even knew such a thing existed. If that's the case, Mikhail Nikolaev believes you're missing out.

events.title: Dozens missing after boat carrying more than 200 migrants capsized off the coast of Gambia
events.description: Gambia's president says dozens are missing after a boat carrying over 200 migrants capsized off the coast

events.title: The Latest: US strikes Venezuela, captures Maduro and his wife
events.description: The United States has launched a large-scale strike on Venezuela, capturing President Nicolás Maduro and his wife

events.title: New year dawns amid rubble and resolve in Gaza
events.description: As 2026 begins, residents of the Gaza Strip are confronting life in displacement camps and among the ruins of destroyed neighbourhoods – facing deep uncertainty after months of war and devastation.

events.title: The Bail Project spent $91M freeing criminal suspects, including some who later committed murder
events.description: The Bail Project spent $90+ million bailing out suspects, including those who allegedly killed people after release. Multiple murders linked to the program.

events.title: Teens' viral prank targeting homeowners could have deadly consequences, police warn
events.description: Kansas police warn about dangerous "door kick challenge" TikTok trend where teens kick doors to mimic home invasions, risking criminal charges and safety.

events.title: From bus driver to dictator: Nicolás Maduro’s rise and fall in Venezuela
events.description: The U.S. had announced a $50 million reward for information leading to Maduro’s arrest before news emerged Saturday of his capture in Venezuela.

events.title: Middle Eastern governments are watching Iran's protests
events.description: As anti-government protests continue in Iran, countries in the region are watching. Some are concerned; others sense potential opportunity.

events.title: Switzerland: Investigators examine nightclub fire origin sparkler link
events.description: As Switzerland mourns, authorities are continuing to investigate the cause of the deadly fire and now believe it was triggered by sparklers placed on champagne bottles that came too close to the bar’s ceiling. Investigators are also examining whether the venue’s materials met fire safety regulations. Meanwhile, families anxiously await news of their loved ones, as some victims have been transferred to specialized burn units in hospitals in France and Italy, while six people remain unidentified. France24 journalist Olivia Bizot reports the latest from Crans-Montana.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Guinea’s junta chief elected president after opposition boycott
events.description: Mamady Doumbouya reneged on promise not to stand and hand west African country back to civilian rule The head of Guinea’s junta, Mamady Doumbouya, who had pledged not to run for office after seizing power four years ago, has been elected president after the country’s electoral commission said he had secured a sweeping majority of the vote. Doumbouya, 41, faced eight rivals for the presidency but the main opposition leaders were barred from running and had urged a boycott of the vote held over the weekend. Continue reading...

events.title: What to know about the Ukrainian general picked by Zelenskyy to be his new chief of staff
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has announced Gen. Kyrylo Budanov, the head of the country’s military intelligence service, as his new chief of staff

events.title: Indonesia’s new penal code takes effect, marking historic break with colonial law
events.description: Indonesia has begun enforcing its newly ratified penal code, replacing a Dutch-era criminal law that had governed the country for more than 80 years and marking a major shift in its legal landscape

events.title: Police identify first four victims of Swiss ski resort fire
events.description: Bodies of two Swiss women aged 21 and 16, and two Swiss men aged 18 and 16 have been returned to their families.

events.title: Zelensky names spy chief to head presidential office after corruption row
events.description: Kyrylo Budanov has led the Hur military intelligence, which has claimed a number of highly-effective strikes against Russia.

events.title: 'Somewhere to put worker bees': Why Canada's micro-condos are losing their appeal
events.description: The condo market in Canada's biggest cities is undergoing a historic crash, with smaller units losing their value faster than any others.

events.title: Trump strikes Venezuela “to force Maduro out”
events.description: The US strikes in Venezuela aim at removing president Nicolas Maduro, says analyst Elias Ferrer

events.title: US ‘adapt, shrink or die’ terms for $2bn aid pot will mean UN bowing down to Washington, say experts
events.description: Afghanistan and Yemen excluded from list of 17 priority countries chosen by Trump administration to receive aid laden with demands The $2bn (£1.5bn) of aid the US pledged this week may have been hailed as “bold and ambitious” by the UN but could be the “nail in the coffin” in changing to a shrunken, less flexible aid system dominated by Washington’s political priorities, aid experts fear. After a year of deep cuts in aid budgets by the US and European countries, the announcement of new money for the humanitarian system is a source of some relief, but experts are deeply concerned about demands that the US has imposed on how the money should be managed and where it can go. Continue reading...

events.title: Grok under fire for sexualizing women and children's images
events.description: Grok's new feature allowing modification of pictures was used on a mass scale to create images of undressed women and children.

events.title: Swiss resort fire: Sparklers likely cause, authorities say
events.description: The fire that tore through a bar in Crans-Montana was likely started by sparklers in Champagne bottles coming too close to the ceiling, authorities have said. Follow DW for more.

events.title: French authorities probe X chatbot Grok over AI-generated nude images
events.description: The controversial X chatbot Grok has come under renewed scrutiny over its use of generative AI to create images that digitally remove clothing from young women and girls, as well as some men. French government ministers have reported the material to prosecutors and to the media regulator ARCOM, which will assess whether the content breaches the European Union’s Digital Services Act, as journalists from France 2 and Simon Mortiz investigate the issue further.

events.title: Anthony Joshua's driver charged over deadly Nigeria crash
events.description: The man behind the wheel of a car that crashed into a lorry in Nigeria, killing two passengers and injuring Anthony Joshua has been charged.

events.title: Why 'Grenfell-like' material made fire spread so fast
events.description: Flammable sound-proofing material is likely to blame for the rapid spread of the deadly fire at a Swiss ski resort, Sky News has been told.

events.title: Gaza aid lifelines under strain as winter worsens
events.description: Humanitarian partners in the Gaza Strip are struggling to reach hundreds of thousands of vulnerable people as winter storms batter damaged homes and temporary shelters.

events.title: EXCLUSIVE: Mom speaks out after illegal alien DUI suspect allegedly kills 8-year-old, maims Marine dad
events.description: Grieving mom demands justice after allegedly intoxicated illegal immigrant kills 8-year-old daughter in crash, leaves Marine father fighting for his life.

events.title: University of Oklahoma teaching assistant fired after flunking Christian student files appeal with school
events.description: Fired University of Oklahoma teaching assistant appeals decision, denies wrongdoing in grading Christian student's paper on gender roles and biblical beliefs.

events.title: Swiss nightclub promoted flaming bottle stunts before deadly inferno in packed New Year's Eve venue
events.description: New Year's Eve nightclub fire in Swiss resort Crans-Montana kills 40, injures 119. Witnesses say bartender carried lit sparkler near wooden ceiling before flames erupted.

events.title: Witnesses give harrowing accounts of New Year's horror that erupted due to Swiss ski resort bar fire
events.description: Eyewitnesses described the grim and horrific scene that ensued due to the fiery blaze that erupted at a bar in Switzerland earlier this week.

events.title: Maduro says Venezuela is 'ready' to make deal with US on drugs and oil after military strikes
events.description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro says his government is ready to negotiate a drug trafficking agreement with the U.S. after months of military pressure.

events.title: Video of Venezuela’s Maduro released hours before ‘capture’
events.description: Hours before the US announced they'd captured Venezuelan President Maduro, state television released a video of him.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Kim Jong-un’s daughter visits state mausoleum, fuelling speculation she will be next North Korean ruler
events.description: Kim Ju-ae has been making increasingly prominent appearances in state media over the past three years The daughter of the North Korean ruler, Kim Jong-un, who is likely being prepared as his successor has accompanied her parents on her first public visit to the Kumsusan mausoleum to pay respects to former leaders, ahead of an event that could see her succession formalised. Photos from state news agency KCNA showed Kim Jong-un accompanied by his wife, Ri Sol-ju, and senior officials on the visit on 1 January, with Ju-ae between her parents in the main hall of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun. Continue reading...

events.title: NewJeans member Danielle sued for millions after bitter feud with K-pop record label
events.description: Ador terminated the Australian-born singer’s contract on Monday and is now suing her, a family member and the band’s former producer The K-pop record label Ador is suing a former member of megaband NewJeans for millions in damages, it has announced, a day after removing her from the group following a year-long dispute that saw the band allege mistreatment and attempt to leave their contract. The compensation suit against Danielle Marsh, a 20-year-old Australian-born singer, comes months after a Seoul district court ruled that NewJeans’ five members must honour their contracts with Ador, whose parent company Hybe is also behind the K-pop sensation BTS. The band’s contract runs until 2029. Continue reading...

events.title: 'The State of South Arabia': Yemen separatists announce plan for independence
events.description: Yemen's southern separatist movement has announced a constitution and aims to hold a referendum on independence from the north.

events.title: Results expected 5 January after landmark elections in Central African Republic
events.description: Voting proceeded largely as planned in the Central African Republic’s first-ever combined presidential, legislative, regional and municipal elections, and ballot counting is now complete, the UN peacekeeping mission (MINUSCA) said on Wednesday, with results expected to be announced on 5 January.

events.title: Georgia teen charged with murdering Uber driver in suburban carjacking, leaving him to die
events.description: Teen charged as adult with murder after Uber driver found shot dead following alleged carjacking incident in suburban Atlanta area on New Year's Day.

events.title: Maduro joins Iraq’s Saddam, Panama’s Noriega as latest leader taken by US
events.description: The reported capture of Venezuelan president evokes previous eras when other leaders were seized by US.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Germany: Third bank robbery reported in NRW in days
events.description: Another day, another report of a robbery at a Sparkasse bank in western Germany. This time, four safe-deposit boxes were emptied in broad daylight.

events.title: Kim Jong Un appears with daughter at mausoleum, fueling succession speculation
events.description: Kim Jong Un's daughter, Ju Ae, appeared at a sacred mausoleum, fueling speculation about North Korea's succession plan as analysts debate her role.

events.title: University of Alabama student suffers 'severe head injury' while on family vacation in Caribbean
events.description: University of Alabama student Matthew Polaski reportedly suffered multiple skull fractures after falling during a family vacation in the Dominican Republic.

events.title: Four challenges facing New York City Mayor Mamdani
events.description: Can the Democratic socialist deliver on the big cost-of-living promises that propelled him to victory?

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: More than 100 shelter overnight in Japan shrine due to heavy snow
events.description: Visitors of the Mitsumine Shrine spent the night there after roads around it were shut off.

events.title: Saudi Arabia calls for Yemeni factions to attend 'dialogue' in Riyadh
events.description: It comes after clashes and an independence bid in southern Yemen bring Saudi and UAE-backed forces into confrontation.

events.title: Craig the beer-ambassador elephant dies aged 54
events.description: The peace-loving pachyderm and lager promoter was an icon of successful conservation, say officials.

events.title: US slashes proposed tariffs on Italian pasta imports
events.description: The plan to impose steep tariffs on 13 producers could have seen major price rises for US consumers.

events.title: Trump says he takes higher daily dose of aspirin than doctors recommend
events.description: In an interview about his health, the US president says: "I don't want thick blood pouring through my heart".

events.title: The year angry men dominated Bollywood - and what it means for India
events.description: Violent, male-driven films dominated the Indian box-office and cultural conversations in 2025.

events.title: Venezuela: American regime change with a Trumpian twist
events.description: Trump has added a particular layer of dementedness to the latest unprovoked US aggression.

events.title: LIVE: Senegal vs Sudan – AFCON 2025
events.description: Follow our live build-up with full team news, in advance of our text commentary stream of the last 16 tie.

events.title: Who is Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro?
events.description: The US has announced it has captured Nicolas Maduro. Al Jazeera takes a look at his political career

events.title: US now owns outcome of “smash-and-grab” Maduro operation
events.description: Analyst Christopher Sabatini says the US raid in Venezuela that removed Nicolas Maduro may have been an inside job

events.title: A New Year for Gaza: Will life return?
events.description: Al Jazeera’s Maram Humaid reflects on a year of famine in Gaza, marked by hunger, loss, and relentless suffering.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Xi Jinping vows to reunify China and Taiwan in New Year’s Eve speech
events.description: Reunification ‘is unstoppable’, says Chinese president, a day after the conclusion of intense military drills China’s president, Xi Jinping, has vowed to reunify China and Taiwan in his annual New Year’s Eve speech in Beijing. Speaking the day after the conclusion of intense Chinese military drills around Taiwan, Xi said: “The reunification of our motherland, a trend of the times, is unstoppable.” Continue reading...

events.title: China forecast to have sold one in every 10 new cars in UK in 2025
events.description: Carmakers such as MG, BYD and Chery are set to pass 200,000 mark in sales, analysis suggests, double 2024’s total Chinese brands are on course to account for one in every 10 new cars sold in Britain during 2025, a marked increase on last year as sales increase across Europe. Manufacturers led by MG, BYD, and Chery are on track to break the 200,000 mark in UK new car sales in 2025, meaning they are very likely to account for 10% of the market, according to Matthias Schmidt, an analyst tracking electric cars across Europe. Continue reading...

events.title: ​Two cubicles, 73 women, one long queue: Japan’s female MPs fight for more loos
events.description: PM Sanae Takaichi joins petition asking for better facilities for women to match improved representation Nearly 60 female lawmakers in Japan, including the prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, have submitted a petition calling for more toilets in the parliament building for women to match their improved representation. Japanese politics remains hugely male-dominated, although the number of women in the parliament rose at the last election – and Takaichi became the first female prime minister in October. This is reflected by there being only one lavatory containing two cubicles for the lower house’s 73 women to use near the Diet’s main plenary session hall in central Tokyo. Continue reading...

events.title: Yemen's separatists announce a constitution for an independent south
events.description: The move comes as an escalation of a confrontation that has pitted Gulf powerhouses Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates against each other.

events.title: U.S. interventions in Latin America and the Caribbean haven't always gone as planned
events.description: President Trump's pressure campaign against Venezuela is the latest in a long saga of U.S. intervention in the region that is rooted in the 1823 Monroe Doctrine — and is a mix of success and failure.

events.title: K-Pop band BTS set to make comeback in March
events.description: The reunion marks the end of a nearly four-year hiatus. All seven members of the South Korean pop boy band BTS have now completed their mandatory military service.

events.title: Why plastic bans aren't working and what needs to change
events.description: Four years after Germany phased out light plastic bags, how has the EU addressed plastic waste — and why do single-use items still pile up in takeaway restaurants, shops and the environment?

events.title: Indian workers earn highest median pay in Germany
events.description: Indian employees have emerged as the highest earners among foreign workers in Germany, a study shows. Elevated pay levels among Indian employees are largely driven by their concentration in technical and academic roles.

events.title: Finnish police arrest 2 over undersea cable damage
events.description: They were part of the crew aboard a cargo vessel suspected of severing a telecom cable linking Finland and Estonia.

events.title: How coup leader Doumbouya might govern democratic Guinea
events.description: The decisive electoral victory for Mamadi Doumbouya has ended Guinea's post-coup transition to civilian rule. Can the elected president turn promises into progress for a nation rich in resources yet poor in opportunity?

events.title: Australia's Northern Territory considers passing assisted dying laws for second time in 31 years
events.description: The Northern Territory government in Australia plans to legislate for doctor-assisted dying for a second time

events.title: Police in Finland arrest 2 in connection with damage to undersea telecom cable
events.description: Finnish authorities have arrested two people in connection with damage to an undersea telecommunications cable in the Gulf of Finland

events.title: The United Arab Emirates says it has withdrawn all its troops from Yemen
events.description: The United Arab Emirates says it has withdrawn all its troops from Yemen

events.title: Military-backed party leads in early election results in Myanmar
events.description: Myanmar's military-appointed election body has announced the winners of the first phase of its three-part general election

events.title: Kim’s daughter visits family mausoleum, promoting her potential status as heir
events.description: The teenage daughter of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has made her first known visit to a sacred family mausoleum where the embalmed bodies of her late grandfather and great-grandfather are on display

events.title: Ireland's Micheál Martin will visit China in the first trip by an Irish leader in 14 years
events.description: Ireland's Prime Minister Micheál Martin visits China starting Sunday, marking the first visit by an Irish leader in 14 years

events.title: Greece cuts student population at universities by half after long study breaks are abolished
events.description: Greek authorities have removed more than 300,000 inactive university students from public university records

events.title: UN chief condemns Israeli amendments targeting UNRWA operations
events.description: The UN Secretary-General has condemned amendments adopted by Israel’s Knesset to a law aimed at ceasing the operations of the UN agency assisting Palestine refugees (UNRWA), saying the measures must be immediately repealed.

events.title: General Assembly approves $3.45 billion UN regular budget for 2026
events.description: The General Assembly has approved a $3.45 billion regular budget for the United Nations for 2026, following weeks of intensive negotiations and one of the Organization’s most important reform initiatives, UN80.

events.title: LIVE: General Assembly decides on 2026 UN budget
events.description: Follow our live coverage as the General Assembly and its Fifth Committee meet today to finalize negotiations and vote on the United Nations’ regular budget for 2026. The Fifth Committee is responsible for administrative and budgetary matters, including the Organization’s finances and staffing. UN News app users can click here and go here for all our in-depth meeting coverage.

events.title: Police seek suspect after dentist and wife found shot dead at home while 2 young children are unharmed
events.description: Columbus dentist Spencer Tepe and wife Monique found shot dead in their home just weeks before their fifth wedding anniversary. Two children unharmed.

events.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Bryan Kohberger video, Slender Man stabber's fate, Luigi Mangione trial
events.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.

events.title: Judge orders accused Jan 6 pipe bomber to remain in custody pending trial
events.description: Brian Cole, accused of planting pipe bombs outside RNC and DNC headquarters in Washington, will be held in custody pending trial after Friday's decision.

events.title: Coast Guard suspends search for 77-year-old woman who went overboard from Holland America Line cruise ship
events.description: Coast Guard suspends search for 77-year-old woman who went overboard from Holland America cruise ship near Cuba on New Year's Day after 8-hour effort.

events.title: Professor slams 'sneaky approach' to oppression-based teaching of American history: 'fantastically false'
events.description: Professor challenges modern American history curriculum in new book, arguing educators present Western culture negatively while omitting critical context.

events.title: Maria Corina Machado emerges as top potential successor after Maduro’s fall
events.description: With Nicolás Maduro out, experts say Nobel laureate María Corina Machado and Edmundo González could lead Venezuela’s transition, though major hurdles remain.

events.title: McDonald's customer caught on camera launching flying kick at employee during heated brawl
events.description: Shocking footage shows customer launching flying kick at McDonald's employee during heated fight at Brazil location. Viral video captures chaotic scene.
